results.title: The Curious coati
results.brief_description: The coati (or coatimundi) is a small Central and South American animal related to the raccoon, and rather like an Australian opossum, but with a very much longer nose. In this film, two baby coatis, because of their inquisitiveness, get into all sorts of mischief in a scientists’ camp in Mexico; coatis are quite fearless, and make good pets.

results.title: The Curiosity that kills the cat
results.creator_credit: G. Buckland-Smith, British Films and Cedric Maggs
results.brief_description: Shows the extent to which animals, specially bred for the purpose or imported wild from overseas, are used in medical research, the pharmaceutical industry and the cosmetic industry. Suggests that some of the vast sums of money spent on animal experiments might be devoted to the development of alternative, more humane techniques.

results.title: The Curb between us
results.brief_description: As a result of a car accident, Terry Kelly became a disabled person. After nine months in hospital Terry tries to rebuild his life with family, friends and his studies. Examines questions such as how it feels to be disabled and the prejudices and problems encountered by the disabled.

results.title: The Cup that cheers
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Documentary Films of India and K Khandpur
results.brief_description: The story of the Indian tea industry which gives employment to about one million workers. Illustrates the various processes involved in its cultivation, manufacture, marketing and exports.

results.title: The Cup Final [1966]
results.brief_description: Opens with a dressing room scene before the commencement of play at Wembley of the 1966 FA Cup Final championship between two great English northern teams, Everton and Sheffield Wednesday.

results.title: The Cup Final [1964]
results.brief_description: The British F.A. Cup Final of 1964 between West Ham and Preston North End. Shows highlights of the game which was called “the best final for many a year”. West Ham were the winners, 3-2.

results.title: The Culinary art of Japan
results.brief_description: Japanese cooking is unique. It is based on seasonal culinary specialities, the preparation and serving of which is considered to be an art. Shows the buying of fresh fish and vegetables, the tea ceremony, a traditional dinner, cooking schools, family meals and the preparation of sukiyaki, tempura and sushi.

results.title: The Cuckoo = Le Coucou
results.creator_credit: Les Cineastes Animaliers Associes, Francois Bel and Gerard Vienne
results.brief_description: A study of the parasitic reproduction of the cuckoo. The cuckoo does not build itself a nest, but lays its eggs in other bird’s nests and leaves them to hatch and rear its young. However, there are hazards associated with parasitic reproduction; barely ten percent of young cuckoos attain their full growth. Uses natural sound only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Les Cineastes Animaliers Associes, Francois Bel and Gerard Vienne
